executable.title: Shrink Image (TubeTK)
executable.description: Project an image into fewer slices. Integration uses the "max" function.
executable.acknowledgements: This work is part of the TubeTK project at Kitware.

integer-vector.name: divideBy
integer-vector.label: Divide by
integer-vector.description: Size of each dimension is divide by this much (must be integers)

integer-vector.name: newSize
integer-vector.label: New size
integer-vector.description: Target size of each dimension (size/newSize must be an integer)

integer-vector.name: overlap
integer-vector.label: Sampling overlap
integer-vector.description: Amount each sliding window region should overlap (in pixels)

boolean.name: gaussian
boolean.label: Gaussian
boolean.description: Generate new voxel using a centered Gaussian weight (instead of max)

boolean.name: log
boolean.label: Log
boolean.description: Compute the values in the log domain

boolean.name: mean
boolean.label: Mean
boolean.description: Generate new voxel using mean (instead of max)

image.name: inputMipPointImageFile
image.label: Input MIP point image file
image.description: A vector image containing the location of the MIP point for each voxel in the shrinked image. Used to shrink an image (e.g. mask) using the MIP point map obtained from shrinking another image. The shrink option parameters -- Gaussian, log, mean -- will have no effect when this parameter is specified. Also shrink amount parameters divideBy, newSize, and/or overlap must have the values that were used to generate this MIP point image file.

image.name: outputMipPointImageFile
image.label: Output MIP point image file
image.description: Save a vector image containing the location of the source MIP point for each voxel in the shrinked image.
